events.originalText: Thirty-six people died when a fire broke out at an illegally converted warehouse in Oakland, California, the deadliest U.S. building fire since 2003.
events.subtitle: Ghost Ship warehouse fire
events.headline: 36 Dead in Oakland Warehouse Fire

events.originalText: In San Bernardino, California, a married couple carried out a mass shooting at a Christmas party before fleeing and dying in a shootout with police.
events.subtitle: San Bernardino, California
events.headline: San Bernardino Shooters Die in Police Shootout

events.originalText: Less than two months after disclosing accounting violations, the Texas-based energy firm Enron filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, evaporating nearly $11 billion in shareholder wealth.
events.subtitle: Enron scandal
events.headline: Enron Files for Bankruptcy, $11 Billion Lost

events.originalText: The Malayan Communist Party and the Malaysian government signed a peace accord to end a 21-year communist insurgency.
events.subtitle: Malayan Communist Party
events.headline: Malayan Communist Party Signs Peace Accord

events.originalText: Benazir Bhutto (pictured) took office as Prime Minister of Pakistan, becoming the first woman to head the government of a Muslim-majority state.
events.subtitle: Benazir Bhutto
events.headline: Benazir Bhutto Becomes First Female PM of Pakistan

events.originalText: Returning from a fact-finding mission, U.S. senator Mike Mansfield became the first American official to comment adversely on the progress of the Vietnam War.
events.subtitle: Mike Mansfield
events.headline: Senator Mansfield Criticizes Vietnam War Progress

events.originalText: Cuban Revolution: The yacht Granma, carrying Fidel Castro, Che Guevara and 80 other members of the 26th of July Movement, reached the shores of Cuba.
events.subtitle: Cuban Revolution
events.headline: Fidel Castro and Che Guevara Land in Cuba

events.originalText: The United States Senate voted of 67 to 22 to approve a resolution condemning Senator Joseph McCarthy who continued to serve in the Senate until his death two and a half years later.
events.subtitle: United States Senate
events.headline: Senate Condemns Senator McCarthy

events.originalText: Korean War: UN forces began a retreat from North Korea following defeat at the Battle of the Ch'ongch'on River.
events.subtitle: Korean War
events.headline: UN Forces Retreat from North Korea

events.originalText: World War II: The Luftwaffe conducted a surprise air raid on Allied ships in Bari, Italy, sinking twenty-eight vessels and releasing one ship's secret cargo of mustard gas.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Luftwaffe Sinks Allied Ships in Bari

events.originalText: Manhattan Project scientists led by Enrico Fermi initiated the first self-sustaining chain reaction in the experimental nuclear reactor Chicago Pile-1.
events.subtitle: Manhattan Project
events.headline: First Nuclear Chain Reaction Initiated in Chicago

events.originalText: The Ford Motor Company introduced the second version of the Model A, its first new model in 18 years.
events.subtitle: Ford Motor Company
events.headline: Ford Introduces New Model A After 18 Years

events.originalText: Philippine–American War: A 60-man Filipino rearguard was defeated at the Battle of Tirad Pass, but delayed the American advance long enough to ensure President Emilio Aguinaldo's escape.
events.subtitle: Philippine–American War
events.headline: Filipino Rearguard Defeated at Battle of Tirad Pass

events.originalText: Louis-Napoléon Bonaparte established the Second French Empire, declaring himself Emperor of the French as Napoleon III.
events.subtitle: Second French Empire
events.headline: Napoleon III Declares Himself Emperor of the French

events.originalText: War of the Third Coalition: French forces led by Napoleon decisively defeated a Russo-Austrian army commanded by Tsar Alexander I at the Battle of Austerlitz (depicted).
events.subtitle: War of the Third Coalition
events.headline: Napoleon Defeats Russo-Austrian Army at Austerlitz
